column4: Apple seeks quick bans on eight Samsung phones
column5: Apple Inc is seeking speedy bans on the sale of eight Samsung Electronics phones  moving swiftly to translate its resounding court victory over its arch-foe into a tangible business benefit. | Video

column5: (Alison Frankel writes the On the Case blog for Thomson Reuters News & Insight http://newsandinsight.com. The views expressed are her own.)

column4: Key Apple engineer cancels retirement
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc said on Monday that Bob Mansfield  a top hardware engineer who announced his retirement in June  is staying on to work on "future products."

column4: Key Apple engineer cancels retirement
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 27 Apple Inc said on Monday that Bob Mansfield  a top hardware engineer who announced his retirement in June  is staying on to work on "future products."

column4: Wall Street finishes flat but Apple reaches another high
column5: NEW YORK Shares of Apple climbed to another record on Monday  keeping the Nasdaq index afloat in the lowest trading volume of the year  with investors looking ahead to a key speech by Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke on Friday. | Video

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St finishes flat but Apple reaches another high
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 27 Shares of Apple climbed to another record on Monday  keeping the Nasdaq index afloat in the lowest trading volume of the year  with investors looking ahead to a key speech by Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke on Friday.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street ends flat but Apple notches another high
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 27 Shares of Apple hit another record on Monday to keep the Nasdaq index afloat in the lowest trading volume of the year  with investors looking ahead to a key speech by Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke on Friday.

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St ends flat; Apple hits record high
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 27 Shares of Apple hit another record on Monday  cushioning the day's losses in a lightly traded market where investors are already looking ahead to a key speech by Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke on Friday.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall Street flat  Apple hits record high
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 27 U.S. stocks were barely changed in light volume on Monday as investors waited for signs from central banks about stimulating the weak economy  though Apple's shares hit a record high after a major court victory.

column4: ASML says Samsung invests in its latest chip technology
column5: AMSTERDAM ASML  the world's top chip equipment maker  said Samsung Electronics would invest 779 million euros ($975 million) in its research into costly next-generation chipmaking technology and in buying a 3 percent equity stake.

column4: UPDATE 7-Hertz to buy car hire rival Dollar Thrifty for $2.56 bln
column5: Aug 27 Hertz Global Holdings agreed to buy rival Dollar Thrifty Automotive Group for about $2.56 billion in a deal that puts the combined company's share of the U.S. car rental market at around 25 percent.

column4: Timeline: Hertz finally drives away with Dollar Thrifty

column4: SEC reviews 'quiet period' IPO rule after Facebook mess
column5: The Securities and Exchange Commission is looking at whether it should relax rules governing what companies can say ahead of initial public offerings  Chairwoman Mary Schapiro said in a letter obtained by Reuters.

column4: UPDATE 1-SEC reviews 'quiet period' IPO rule after Facebook mess
column5: Aug 27 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is looking at whether it should relax rules governing what companies can say ahead of initial public offerings  Chairwoman Mary Schapiro said in a letter obtained by Reuters.

column4: German consumer group sets Facebook privacy ultimatum
column5: FRANKFURT/BERLIN Germany's biggest consumer lobby group believes Facebook is violating privacy laws with its new app centre and has set a deadline for the social network operator to fix it  or potentially face legal action.

column4: Facebook envisions swanky new digs as shares sink
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc on Friday unveiled plans for a massive new campus annex in Menlo Park to be designed by Frank Gehry  the renowned architect who has won plaudits for metal-sheathed works like the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao  Spain  and the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles.

column4: SEC to review "quiet period" IPO rule after Facebook mess - WSJ
column5: Aug 27 U.S. stock market regulator the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is reviewing whether to relax rules governing what companies can say ahead of initial public offerings  the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

column4: FDA approves Gilead's four-drug HIV treatment
column5: U.S. health regulators on Monday approved Gilead Sciences Inc's four-drug combination pill to treat HIV  the virus that causes AIDS.

column4: Trimble to buy logistics software maker for $355 million
column5: Trimble Navigation Ltd  agreed to buy privately held TMW Systems Inc  which provides enterprise software to transportation and logistics companies  for $335 million in cash.

column4: UPDATE 1-Trimble to buy logistics software maker for $355 mln
column5: * TMW helps transportation firms store data  automate business processes

column4: Trimble to buy privately held software maker for $355 mln
column5: Aug 27 Trimble Navigation Ltd agreed to buy privately held TMW Systems Inc  which provides enterprise software to transportation and logistics companies  for $335 million in cash.

column4: UPDATE 1-Italy miners barricade themselves underground with explosives
column5: ROME  Aug 27 Up to 100 Sardinian miners armed with hundreds of kilograms of explosives have barricaded themselves nearly 400 metres underground in Italy's only coal mine to put pressure on the Rome government to protect its survival.

column4: ADM shuts New Orleans grain elevators as Isaac approaches
column5: Aug 27 Archer Daniels Midland Co. said on Monday it shut down its four grain elevators in New Orleans to prepare for Tropical Storm Isaac.

column4: Best Buy agrees to open books to founder Schulze
column5: Best Buy Co Inc  agreed to open its books to founder and former chairman Richard Schulze to allow him to firm up a potential $8.8 billion buyout bid for the struggling U.S. consumer electronics retailer. | Video

column4: Best Buy  Schulze reach deal for due diligence
column5: Aug 27 Best Buy Co Inc said on Monday that it reached a deal with its founder Richard Schulze  allowing him to conduct due diligence and form an investment group with private equity sponsors.

column4: BHP Billiton shuts  evacuates two U.S. Gulf platforms before storm
column5: HOUSTON BHP Billiton said on Monday that it would fully evacuate and shut its two oil and gas platforms in the Gulf of Mexico by day's end  ahead of Tropical Storm Isaac's arrival.

column4: TEXT-Fitch affirms Bentoel's rupiah bond at 'AAA(idn)'
column5: Aug 27 - Fitch Ratings has affirmed PT Bentoel Internasional Investama Tbk's (Bentoel) IDR1.35tn senior unsecured notes due on 27 November 2012 at 'AAA(idn)'.

column4: UPDATE 2-Ackman again urges General Growth to sell to Simon
column5: BOSTON/NEW YORK  Aug 27 Hedge fund manager William Ackman turned up the heat on General Growth Properties on Monday  urging the mall operator to enter talks to sell itself to a rival while also assuring other shareholders that he has no plans to sell out in a hurry.

column4: Ackman again urges General Growth to sell to Simon
column5: NEW YORK Hedge fund manager William Ackman on Monday again urged the board of mall owner General Growth Properties Inc  to enter into talks with larger rival Simon Property Group   after Brookfield Asset Management Inc   General Growth's largest shareholder  said it was not interested in acquiring all of the company.

column4: Citigroup to settle MBS suit for $24.9 million
column5: NEW YORK Citigroup Inc has agreed to pay nearly $25 million to settle a lawsuit by investors who said they were misled about the quality of mortgage-backed securities they bought just before the U.S. housing market crashed  according to court papers filed Monday in federal court.

column4: Coeur d'Alene suspends underground ops at its Mexico mine
column5: Aug 27 Silver miner Coeur d'Alene Mines Corp suspended work at the underground portion of its Palmarejo silver and gold mine in Mexico  after one worker fell to death while performing maintenance work.
